reviewText: It's a nice little puzzle with impossible geometry and perspective shifts. Rather short, but I think the price is right (actually I won it in a giveaway).\n\nAlso it's +8 easy achievements for the achievement hunters.

reviewText: Very intresting mechanics that are new to me and are really fun to play with. The puzzles (so far - world 4) are relatively easy and aren't fustrating to figure out. But it is still fun, it isn't boringly easy. It's tricky enough to provide some relaxed entertainment, great game for the price as well. Also the main robot guy is super cute and there is a little story that goes on to.\n\nThe only annoying part is the tutorial/guide goes on a little to long. I thought it was going to go on for the whole game, which thankfully it didn't. I don't click anything for 3 seconds and it starts showing me what to do. Telling you where to click for an entire level was off putting beause I just wanted to figure it out myself.

reviewText:
If you like Echochrome, play it!
If you like Monument Valley, play it!
If you like FEZ, play it!
The game is 1~2 hours length, the puzzles are awesome, and with some unique originality.
Worth the price and you must play it!

reviewText: The game is wonderful and relaxing. It uses geometry as puzzles to really make for some beautiful moments. Beautiful images and music, simple gameplay but very fun and never frustrating. Fast to finish for a good puzzle solver. Hope there will be more like this from this developer. I recommend this game fully. Just buy it now :D

reviewText: Excellent puzzle design, smooth & relaxing music, and aesthetically pleasing. Definitely worth the $2.

reviewText: Very relaxing puzzle game that plays with perspective and the laws of physics. Its like navigating around an MC Escher drawing that you can rotate and manipulate. It is very much like Monument Valley for Android or iOS. I really enjoyed that game and played through all the available levels they put out. Finally I get a similar game play and aesthetic from this game with some new twists. Definitely worth the 2 dollars.

reviewText: very well made game, could use improvement in some areas but overall well executed game, if you like puzzles that are easy and hard at the same time, buy this.

Product received for free

https://youtu.be/NSgWZ8UB59Y

Full English review of the game: http://grandpagaming.blogspot.nl/2016...
Volledige Nederlandse beoordeling van het spel: http://grandpagaming.blogspot.nl/2016...

Short version below / Korte versie staat hieronder.

Do you like Escher or solving creative puzzles in a lovely environment? Then don't miss this game. It's well executed, challenging, looks lovely and plays well. The optical illusions and secrets are well done. With over 40 levels and an absolutely low price, this game is a great break from the usual genres. My verdict.... a 10 out of 10 without a doubt.

Houd je van Escher of puzzel spellen in een leuke spelomgeving? Mis dan dit spel niet. Het is erg goed gemaakt, uitdagend, ziet er leuk uit en speelt prima. De optische illusies en geheimen zijn mooi gedaan. Met ruim 40 levels en een absoluut lage prijs is dit spel een goede afwisseling van de gewoonlijke genres. Mijn oordeel..... zonder twijfel een 10 uit 10.

reviewText: I loved this - almost exactly like Monument Valley so if you liked that you will definitely like this! The story is irrelevant - it is the puzzles that are the game and they are well done. If you want a nice, relaxing game then give this one a try.

reviewText:
Not bad.

This game claims to be inspired by 'Monument Valley', but it's difficult to say that it is like M.V.  It's easier to say that it kinda rips off M.V. in many ways, but with much less 'Escher'.  There are a few unique ideas, but most folks will be marching right through the puzzles in no time, with very few hangups.  My play time of 1.3 hours included beating it plus folding 3 loads of laundry.

Is it worth the 2 bucks?  I think so.  Is it spectacular?  No, it's 2 bucks.
